questions: Q1) why life on mars is subject of intrest ?
answers: Ans) The possibilities of life on Mars is a subject of interest in astrobiology due to the planet's proximity and similarities to Earth.

questions: Q2) is there any proof of life on Mars ?
answers: Ans) To date, no proof of past or present life has been found on Mars.

questions: Q3) when did the search for life begin in mars ?
answers: Ans) Scientific searches for evidence of life began in the 19th century and continue today via telescopic investigations and deployed probes.

questions: Q4) what oes the surface of mars consists of ?
answers: Ans) the surface of Mars is bathed with ionizing radiation, and Martian soil is rich in perchlorates toxic to microorganisms.
